text: hello everyone Amazon detective
simplifies the investigative process and
helped security teams conduct faster and
more effective investigations by
grouping related security findings
together into finding groups and graph
visualization
today I will show you how you can use
these features to enhance your security
event investigations
detective automatically collects log
data from AWS cloudtrail logs Amazon
virtual private cloud or Amazon VPC flow
logs and Amazon card jury findings
detective also has optional data sources
that you can add to conduct broader
security investigations across a wide
variety of Security Services which
include AWS security Hub Amazon
inspector Amazon Macy and others once
the data sources are enabled detective
will automatically group related
security findings into finding groups to
help you conduct faster investigations
threat actors often perform a series of
actions when attempting to compromise
your AWS environment which can result in
multiple security findings across your
AWS resources
finding groups is a collection of
findings and resources that are
associated with a single potential
security incident
using finding groups and graph
visualization as your starting point
will reduce Time by giving you a
complete view of the security event
rather than a list of all findings let
us now navigate to the detective service
to see these features in action
search and click on detective service
click on General under settings
click on edit under optional Source
packages
click on AWS security findings and
select save
detective will now automatically ingest
findings sent to AWS security Hub to
build the behavior graph for your
investigations
you can review finding groups which is
an active investigation to see
correlated God jury findings and
affected AWS resources
the title of the findings is structured
to the miter attack framework it also
gives a description of the associated
tactics in the finding group summary you
can see the AWS accounts observed during
the event the resources involved in the
event the different findings associated
with the finding group along with the
active scope of the investigation
click on the title of the finding group
to dive deeper into the investigation
you can further review The observed
tactics by clicking on the tactics
highlighted in the finding group scroll
down to the graph visualization here you
will be able to see different entities
involved in the security investigation
for the demo I've closed the left hand
panel to get a full view of the
visualization the legend reveals more
details about the icons in the
visualization the nodes on the graph
visualization are interactive which
means you can click and drag the
findings and involved entities to
analyze the security event
the security event begins with lower
severity actions to discover the I.T
landscape before translating into high
severity activity
moving our duty findings around helps
identify connected resources across
multiple findings
you can move the connected resources to
build an event pattern with the support
for AWS security Hub you can also pivot
from security Hub findings and
investigate them with Amazon Detective
with this enhanced capability you can
use detective to conduct more
comprehensive investigations thank you
for your time and ensure that you
consult the Amazon detective
documentation for more information on
these features
